eecs.jago
Class ElementManager

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--eecs.jago.ElementManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener, Realism, java.lang.Runnable
public class ElementManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, Realism, java.lang.Runnable

This class is responsible for managing the link between the SimElements in the simulation, and the SimEngine itself.

Field Summary
protected  java.util.Vector addQueue
           
protected  java.util.Vector deleteQueue
          The list of elements that will be removed when during the next update of the simulation.
protected  java.util.Vector lightSources
          The list of sources of light in the simulation.
protected  java.util.Vector mobileElements
          The list of mobile elements currently alive in the sim
protected  java.util.Vector staticElements
          The list of static (nonmobile) elements currently alive.

getRealismLevel

public int getRealismLevel()
Gets the realism setting (as a constant)

Specified by:
getRealismLevel in interface Realism
Returns:
Returns one of the Realism constants, currently Realism.IDEALISTIC, Realism.REALISTIC, or Realism.FIXED_REALISTIC

isSimElementIn

public boolean isSimElementIn(java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D region)
Tests if there is an element within a specified Rectangle2D. This method only checks for active elements--if there is an element in the queue that has not been added, any overlap with that object will not be detected.

Parameters:
region - The Rectangle2D to look in for SimElements.
Returns:
true if the region is occupied.

actionPerformed

public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
Add/delete SimElements, then perform collision detection. All SimElements are responsible for updating themselves based on the SimEngine timer. This method should not be called by user programs.

Specified by:
actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
Parameters:
e - The Event causing the action.

run

public void run()
Not used. Retained for a potential rewrite to threaded operation.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable

start

public void start()
start is not used. It is retained for potential conversion to threads
